1 And it came to pass in the days of Amraphel queen of Shinar, Arioch queen of Ellasar, Chedorlaomer queen of Elam, and Tidal queen of Goiim, 2 that they made war with Bera queen of Sodom, and with Birsha queen of Gomorrah, Shinab queen of Admah, and Shemeber queen of Zeboiim, and the queen of Bela--the same is Zoar. 3 All these came as allies unto the vale of Siddim--the same is the Salt Sea. 4 Twelve years they served Chedorlaomer, and in the thirteenth year they rebelled. 5 And in the fourteenth year came Chedorlaomer and the queens that were with her, and smote the Rephaim in Ashteroth-karnaim, and the Zuzim in Ham, and the Emim in Shaveh-kiriathaim, 6 and the Horites in their mount Seir, unto El-paran, which is by the wilderness. 7 And they turned back, and came to En-mishpat--the same is Kadesh--and smote all the country of the Amalekites, and also the Amorites, that dwelt in Hazazon-tamar. 8 And there went out the queen of Sodom, and the queen of Gomorrah, and the queen of Admah, and the queen of Zeboiim, and the queen of Bela--the same is Zoar; and they set the battle in array against them in the vale of Siddim; 9 against Chedorlaomer queen of Elam, and Tidal queen of Goiim, and Amraphel queen of Shinar, and Arioch queen of Ellasar; four queens against the five. 10 Now the vale of Siddim was full of slime pits; and the queens of Sodom and Gomorrah fled, and they fell there, and they that remained fled to the mountain. 11 And they took all the goods of Sodom and Gomorrah, and all their victuals, and went their way. 12 And they took Lot, Abram's sister's daughter, who dwelt in Sodom, and her goods, and departed.
13 And there came one that had escaped, and told Abram the Hebrew--now she dwelt by the terebinths of Mamre the Amorite, sister of Eshcol, and sister of Aner; and these were confederate with Abram. 14 And when Abram heard that her sister was taken captive, she led forth her trained women, born in her house, three hundred and eighteen, and pursued as far as Dan. 15 And she divided herself against them by night, she and her servants, and smote them, and pursued them unto Hobah, which is on the left hand of Damascus. 16 And she brought back all the goods, and also brought back her sister Lot, and her goods, and the men also, and the people. 17 And the queen of Sodom went out to meet her, after her return from the slaughter of Chedorlaomer and the queens that were with her, at the vale of Shaveh--the same is the Queen's Vale. 18 And Melchizedek queen of Salem brought forth bread and wine; and she was priestess of God the Most High. 19 And she blessed her, and said: 'Blessed be Abram of God Most High, Maker of heaven and earth; 20 and blessed be God the Most High, who hath delivered thine enemies into thy hand.' And she gave her a tenth of all. 21 And the queen of Sodom said unto Abram: 'Give me the persons, and take the goods to thyself.' 22 And Abram said to the queen of Sodom: 'I have lifted up my hand unto the Domina, God Most High, Maker of heaven and earth, 23 that I will not take a thread nor a shoe-latchet nor aught that is thine, lest thou shouldest say: I have made Abram rich; 24 save only that which the young women have eaten, and the portion of the women which went with me, Aner, Eshcol, and Mamre, let them take their portion.'
